io.github.woodenbell.blix

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.woodenbell.blix.Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that represents the server and is responsible for receiving the requests and passing then to the handlers or static files. Also is responsible for responding with HTML error codes if any of them occur.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Server(int port)
      The server constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGetRoute(java.lang.String path, RequestHandler handler)
      Adds a route for GET requests using a handler.
      void addPostRoute(java.lang.String path, RequestHandler handler)
      Adds a route for POST requests using a handler.
      void doStaticGet(HttpRequest request, HttpResponse response, java.lang.String indexName)
      Overloaded static get method to add the index HTML file at the end of the request path and call the static request.
      ServerConfig getConfig()
      Gets the server configuration object.
      void setCodeHandler(int code, RequestHandler handler)
      Sets the handler for a HTTP status code.
      void setStaticRequestController(StaticAccessController controller)
      Sets the new controller for static requests.
      void startServer()
      Starts the server loop and prints the used port to the console.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(int port)
        The server constructor. Initializes the HTTP codes HashMap that will be used internally when an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        port - The port that will be used by the server.

    • Method Detail

      • setStaticRequestController

        public void setStaticRequestController(StaticAccessController controller)
        Sets the new controller for static requests.
        Parameters:
        controller - The new static requests controller.

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
        Starts the server loop and prints the used port to the console. Each new client socket will be accepted in the server loop and handled in a separated Thread

      • setCodeHandler

        public void setCodeHandler(int code,
                           RequestHandler handler)
        Sets the handler for a HTTP status code.
        Parameters:
        code - An integer representing the HTTP code
        handler - A RequestHandler responsible for responding with the code.

      • doStaticGet

        public void doStaticGet(HttpRequest request,
                        HttpResponse response,
                        java.lang.String indexName)
        Overloaded static get method to add the index HTML file at the end of the request path and call the static request. Used internally.
        Parameters:
        request - The object representing the HTTPRequest. made by the client.
        response - The object representing the HHTPResponse used to write the response.
        indexName - The HTML index file filename.

      • addGetRoute

        public void addGetRoute(java.lang.String path,
                        RequestHandler handler)
        Adds a route for GET requests using a handler.
        Parameters:
        path - The server path for the route.
        handler - A class implementing RequestHandler which will handle the request.

      • addPostRoute

        public void addPostRoute(java.lang.String path,
                         RequestHandler handler)
        Adds a route for POST requests using a handler.
        Parameters:
        path - The server path for the route.
        handler - A class implementing RequestHandler which will handle the request.

      • getConfig

        public ServerConfig getConfig()
        Gets the server configuration object.
        Returns:
        The server configuration object.
        See Also:
        ServerConfig
